intro: Diapedium squarrosum, commonly known as the roughleaf diapedium, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a rough or hairy texture. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often blooming during the warmer months.
